name: Seated Diaphragmatic Breathing

instructions.description: Sit comfortably in a chair with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
Place one hand on your chest and the other on your abdomen, just below your rib cage.
Inhale deeply through your nose, allowing your abdomen to expand as you breathe in. Feel your hand on your abdomen rise while keeping your chest relatively still.
Exhale slowly through your mouth, feeling your abdomen fall as you breathe out. Ensure your chest remains stable.

commentsNotes: Ensure to maintain a relaxed posture throughout the exercise.
Focus on the quality of your breath rather than the quantity.
If you feel lightheaded or dizzy, return to normal breathing immediately.
Avoid straining your neck or shoulders during the exercise.
